title: Can't Connect to pvp.net(But a little different)
body:
This is not the same problem everyone else is having.I made an account in the North American server and it works perfectly.I've tried changing my dns, port forwarding, restarting my router , resetting my router,and all other fixes that is available online.I finally tried hiding my IP,making it seem like I'm from USA.(It seems that the error only exists when I try to connect to the Oceanic server). This helped me get in but then the ping was so high, I couldn't even connect to chat.As soon as i revealed my ip,showing I'm from India again,the game disconnected me from pvp.net .I have played for 4 months without this problem.It showed up just last week and I've been trying everythin I can ever since. Please help me!

P.S. I'm from India

replies.body: What issue are you having exactly? You didn't actually describe, just the things which you've done previously.

I'm sorry, but I don't like clicking shifty-looking links with no explanation from strangers. Could you please use the built-in attachment feature of the boards to upload the image? If that doesn't work, could you describe the situation, and when it occurs?
Its just gyazo lol! But here you go anyways.

I've never heard of gyazo before, lol. For all I know, it could be the name of a well-known malicious software developer. :P

Have you tried [using an alternative DNS](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664#wq5)?

Yes I have. Google's dns and many others aswell....Now,this has turned more weirder! I can connect in the morning,but after some time it disconnects me.I can also connect after 1pm.But,in the night,it disconnects me again at 10 pm or something...This is pretty weird(it shows connection timed out and all)

Are you sure you flushed your DNS after changing it? As well as reset your computer?

[Check out the entirety of this page.](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664) If after trying everything there doesn't work, just wait it out. It's most likely a server side issue.

You might also want to try port forwarding, which is actually far more complicated then what the article glosses over. If you want to try that, just ask. You'll need to tell me the brand of your router and what OS you are on.

Did everything you said lol.Also,I did everything on the page.My computer was factory reset just a month before  I got the game (in december). I haven't come across this problem till last week. Port forwarding is easy xD . And like I said before, it sometimes works in the morning and after 1pm. But then I get this error again.

>Port forwarding is easy

More or less comes down to "have you tampered with your router settings before?" If you have, it is actually pretty easy. If you haven't, it could be quite hard. Most people don't even know that their router has a setting page, let alone the password to access it.

Do you use any VPN or proxy? If you do, disable that. Also, try uninstalling any anti-virus or firewall you may have installed (not just close, *completely uninstall*). Make sure to always run in admin mode until you find a solution.

Well...I'll try reinstalling my anti virus (I'll run the game after uninstalling and then reinstall it).I uninstalled my vpn service because it is too laggy (I can connect to oceanic using a vpn ). Also,I haven't tampered with my router ever since i reset it last year,other than the fact that I did what was mentioned on the league of legends help page. Also,the game lets me connect to oceanic some times,but after some time,it disconnects me again.Kind of weird.(I even got a 20min leaverbuster because of this issue....my north american account still works like a charm though)

Very weird. This probably goes beyond what I or any other player here can do to help. It's most likely a server side issue, or ISP specific. You can try calling up your ISP and see if they can help you out with it, though I doubt that anything less than contacting Riot and getting them to fix it will net you any results.

Oh yeah, it's against the EULA to use a VPN to connect to League. Just saying.

When you make a League of Legends account it is tied to the server you create it on i.e. North America. If you would like to play on the oceanic servers you must either make a new account or pay to have your existing account transferred over to the oceanic servers.
Bro....It IS on oceanic.I created a NEW (temporary) account in NORTH AMERICA to test if its a problem with my computer.
